frame.name: Reading_aloud
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> interprets a written <fen>Text</fen> and speaks the contents as <fen>Speech</fen>, usually to an <fen>Addressee</fen>. The contents of the speech may be the <fen>Text</fen> verbatim or a representation of the text. Because the contents of the <fen>Text</fen> are reproduced as the <fen>Speech</fen>, often only one or the other is expressed. This reading may be described by the <fen>Manner</fen> in which it is read, by a <fen>Judgment</fen>, or a <fen>Part_of_speech</fen> (a constituent of the speech).</def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>The person or people to whom the Speaker is directing his message.</def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The language user who reads the Text aloud.</def-root>

FE.name: Text
FE.definition: <def-root>A piece of writing, the source from which the Speaker reads.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The way that the Speaker produces the Speech.</def-root>

FE.name: Speech
FE.definition: <def-root>The vocalized sound sequence that the Speaker produces from interpretation of the Text.</def-root>

FE.name: Judgment
FE.definition: <def-root>An evaluation of whether the Speech that the Speaker produced matches the standard or standard range.</def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The medium from which the Text is read.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The result that the <fen>Speaker</fen> is trying to achieve by reading aloud.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location at which the reading takes place.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: read.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to interpret and speak aloud (the contents of a written message)

lexUnit.name: read out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to pronounce a written text out loud.
